summary: This document is a Deed of Trust prepared by Fifth Third Mortgage Company, outlining the terms of a loan secured by property located in Charlotte, North Carolina. It details the roles of the Borrower, Lender, and Trustee, as well as the obligations of the Borrower regarding payments and escrow items. This document outlines the terms and conditions related to a loan agreement, specifically focusing on the responsibilities of the Borrower regarding property insurance, occupancy, maintenance, and the handling of miscellaneous proceeds. It details the obligations of the Borrower to maintain insurance and the rights of the Lender in case of default or property damage. This document outlines the terms and conditions of a security instrument related to a loan agreement, detailing the obligations of the borrower and lender, including provisions for liability, notices, and remedies in case of default. It also includes sections on hazardous substances and the rights of the borrower to reinstate after acceleration of the loan.

persons.name: Donald P. Eggleston
persons.context: Donald P. Eggleston is named as the Trustee in the Deed of Trust, responsible for holding the property in trust for the Lender.

persons.name: Joann Brown
persons.context: Joann Brown is identified as the loan originator for the mortgage agreement detailed in the document.

locations: 435 S Tryon St Unit 700, Charlotte, NC 28202
keyFacts: The Borrower is Requiro Terra, LLC, a Florida Limited Liability Company.
The Lender is Fifth Third Mortgage Company.
The loan amount is $325,000.00, due by January 1, 2030.
The document outlines the obligations of the Borrower regarding payments, escrow items, and property liens.
The Deed of Trust secures the repayment of the loan and the performance of the Borrower's covenants.
The Borrower is required to maintain property insurance against various hazards as stipulated by the Lender.
If the Borrower fails to maintain insurance, the Lender may obtain coverage at the Borrower's expense.
The Borrower must occupy the property as their principal residence within 60 days of executing the Security Instrument.
The document specifies that any insurance proceeds must be applied to the restoration or repair of the property unless deemed economically unfeasible.
The Borrower is in default if they provide materially false information during the loan application process.
The document is a security instrument outlining the obligations of the borrower and lender.
It specifies that the borrower remains liable even if the lender grants extensions or modifications.
The lender may charge fees for services related to the borrower's default.
Borrower has the right to reinstate the loan under certain conditions after acceleration.
Joann Brown is the loan originator associated with this mortgage agreement.
